abstract: Op-Ed article by Anne Speckhard underscores necessity of United States speeding up its refugee acceptance process, both for humanitarian reasons and for nation's security; notes longer refugees are in limbo, more likely they are to be radicalized by terrorist; points out that by accepting more Syrians in need of refuge, US could diminish pool of refugees from which Islamic State can recruit.
lead_paragraph: The data is clear: Most terrorists don’t land on American soil from the ranks of refugees but are people born here and recruited.

headline.main: How Dragging Our Feet on Refugees Creates More Terrorists
